reasoning: Post-MI incidence reflects the rate of new myocardial infarction events (~120 per 100k globally from 2005 estimates). Reported as incidence (new MI events per year), with high geographic variation from <50 in low-income regions to >200 in high-income countries due to differences in coronary risk factors, healthcare access, and case ascertainment.
source: Rosamond W et al. (2008). Heart disease and stroke statistics--2008 update: a report from the American Heart Association Statistics Committee and Stroke Statistics Subcommittee. Circulation. 117(4):e25-e146
